title: Nominees for The Economic Times Startup Awards 2025; and other top stories this week
description: Welcome to a new edition of ETtech Unwrapped – our weekend newsletter packed with the most important stories from this week. Let’s take a look at the recap.

title: Nominees for The Economic Times Startup Awards 2025; and other top stories this week
description: Welcome to a new edition of ETtech Unwrapped – our weekend newsletter packed with the most important stories from this week. Let’s take a look at the recap.

title: Mitsubishi Fuso and Foxconn sign MOU to develop zero-emission buses for global markets
description: Mitsubishi Fuso Truck and Bus Corporation (MFTBC), a leading name in Japan's commercial vehicle industry, and Hon Hai Technology Group (Foxconn), the world's largest electronics manufacturer, have signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) to explore a strate…

title: Nvidia Halts H20 Chip Production Amid China Crackdown
description: Chip restrictions intensify as Beijing pushes back on U.S. tech dominance

title: We can’t be oblivious about China, says Shashi Tharoor, flags Beijing’s deliberate economic moves
description: Shashi Tharoor cautioned against complacency regarding China, highlighting Beijing's strategic and economic maneuvers to pressure India. He cited instances like rare earth restrictions and Foxconn engineer actions as deliberate decisions. Tharoor also noted t…

title: Foxconn subsidiary pulls back 300 Chinese engineers from India: Report
description: Earlier in July, Apple supplier Foxconn had similarly recalled around 300 Chinese engineers and technicians from its iPhone production facilities in India.

title: Nvidia stocks in focus as Jensen Huang asks suppliers to halt H20 chip work
description: Nvidia shares slipped in early trading Friday as investors reacted to reports that CEO Jensen Huang has asked suppliers to halt work on its China-specific H20 AI chip, raising fresh concerns over U.S. export rules just days before the company’s blockbuster ea…

title: Nvidia Halts China Chip Production as Beijing Warns Over Security, Reports Say
description: Nvidia reportedly has told suppliers to suspend production of its H20 chip, after Beijing asked local firms to avoid using the chip tailored for the Chinese ...

title: Nvidia asks Foxconn to stop working on H20 AI chip, Reuters says
description: See the rest of the story here. thefly.com provides the latest financial news as it breaks. Known as a leader in market intelligence, The Fly's real-time, streaming news feed keeps individual investors, professional money managers, active traders, and corpor…

title: India’s Semiconductor Market To Grow To $100-110 Billion In 2030, Government Approves 10 Projects
description: Backed by government schemes offering up to 50 per cent fiscal support, India’s semiconductor market is projected to grow from $45-50 billion in 2024-25 to $100-110 billion by 2030, said the report in India Narrative.

title: Nvidia CEO in Taipei to visit TSMC, says in talks with US over new China chip
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang arrived in Taipei on Friday to visit chip foundry partner TSMC, as the world's most valuable company navigates rising friction between Washington and Beijing over access to its industry-leading AI chips.

title: Nvidia Urges Taiwan to Embrace Nuclear Power Ahead of Referendum
description: Nuclear power is an “excellent option” for Taiwan, as demand from energy-intensive artificial intelligence is set to skyrocket in the tech manufacturing hub, according to Nvidia Corp.

title: Foxconn reportedly recalls 300 Chinese engineers from India, appoints Robert Wu as new India Representative
description: Foxconn subsidiary Yuzhan Technology has recalled roughly 300 Chinese engineers from its India facility, marking the second such instance in recent months, sources told the Economic Times. The move comes amid ongoing geopolitical sensitivities and reflects Be…

title: US and China are thwarting India’s shot at $7 trillion solar prize
description: India's solar industry is poised for significant growth, potentially rivaling China by the mid-2030s, driven by increasing domestic demand and a desire to compete in export markets. However, the industry faces challenges including rising US tariffs and heavy …
